page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: This block covers part of the East end of{Newcastle,part of Wallsend and {Hebburn,the}last being separated from the rest by the R.Tyne.Nearly half the area is{residential}with mostly semi_ detached and terraced houses with some high rise flats,of all ages from pre_ war.There is still a considerable amount of manufacturing industry, mostly{light engineering}with a reduced number of{shipyards.}Areas of derelict land show in part the decline of heavy industry.Modernisation and re_building is evident in houses, shopping areas and the use of derelict or open space for recreational facilities.{Communication}by road is good and the recently introduced Metro system provides East_West passenger access on both sides of the River.Land {height}above sea(river)level does not exceed about 45m.
